summary: Since 2011, Burma has been in transition from authoritarian rule toward democracy. Since 2012, USAID and State have obligated over $113 million to support this transition, including efforts to strengthen the country's democratic institutions. USAID and State take steps to ensure that democracy projects support specified goals. However, they could do more to ensure that partners (e.g., non-governmental organizations) are doing what they can to...
title: U.S. Democracy Assistance in Burma: USAID and State Could Strengthen Oversight of Partners' Due Diligence Procedures
